content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 3 to node 13 in the given graph is:

3 -> 4 -> 7 -> 13

Please note that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, the shortest path from node 13 to node 3 would be:

7 -> 4 -> 3

If you have any further questions, please let me know.

The shortest path from node 13 to node 3 in the given graph is:

13 -> 4 -> 3

This shortest path is composed of three edges: 13-4, 4-3 and does not involve any loops or multiple edges. Please let me know if you have any further questions.
